Class Option

java.lang.Object
AbstractOption
Option
All Implemented Interfaces:
Derivative
public class Option
extends AbstractOption
implements Derivative
This is an Option class. An Option has a strike price, a premium or price payed, an expiration date, an option type, a name, and an implied volatility. Construction of Option objects sets their position to LONG by default, but this can be set by the user to SHORT if they desire.

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from class AbstractOption

    expiration, impliedVol, optionName, position, premium, strike, type

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    Option​(java.math.BigDecimal strike, java.math.BigDecimal premium, java.util.Date expiration, OptionType type, java.lang.String name, java.math.BigDecimal IV)
    An Option is constructed by passing in a strike price, a premium, an expiration date, an OptionType, a name, and an Implied Volatility

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.math.BigDecimal calcProfit​(int stockPrice)
    calcProfit calculates the profit, or loss, of the Option at any given stock price.It considers the type of option, call or put, and the position on it taken by the investor, long or short.

  • Constructor Details

    • Option

      public Option​(java.math.BigDecimal strike, java.math.BigDecimal premium, java.util.Date expiration, OptionType type, java.lang.String name, java.math.BigDecimal IV) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      An Option is constructed by passing in a strike price, a premium, an expiration date, an OptionType, a name, and an Implied Volatility
      Parameters:
      strike - - the strike price of the option
      premium - - the premium or price payed/sold for the option
      expiration - - the expiration date of the option
      type - - the type of option (put or call)
      name - - the name of the option
      IV - - the implied volatility of the option
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if an invalid price or premium is passed in

  • Method Details

    • calcProfit

      public java.math.BigDecimal calcProfit​(int stockPrice)
      calcProfit calculates the profit, or loss, of the Option at any given stock price.It considers the type of option, call or put, and the position on it taken by the investor, long or short.
      Parameters:
      stockPrice - the stock price used in the profit calculation
      Returns:
      the profit/loss of the Option at the given stock price

      public java.lang.String toString()
